subject: Re: [junit] Testing J2EE applications
msgSnippet: hi i dont know about the junitee.but presently we are using super150 -a EJB testing tool which is working quite fine. if u are using weblogic 5.1 then u can as
messageBody:
hi
i dont know about the junitee.but presently we are using super150 -a EJB testing tool which is working quite fine.
if u are using weblogic 5.1 then u can as well go for EJBVerify-an another testing tool
----- Original Message -----
From: Kaarle Kaila
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, September 19, 2001 5:28 PM
Subject: [junit] Testing J2EE applications

I have been looking into ways of testing J2EE
applications with JUnit. Part of my application are
straight methods that I can test locally but other
parts requires the J2EE environment to be active
(weblogic in this case).

I found a package called junitee at sourgeforge that
could test my Java classes or EJB's nicely.

Then when was looking for more info I found the Cactus
project that looks like it could do this sort of
testing.

I have (not yet) managed to use Cactus. I will look
more into it but would like to ask your opinion!

Do you know the status of junitee ?
My email to the author was not delivered ?
(I made a path to it that I tried to send to him)

With junitee you cannot test jsp-pages but about all
the rest if I am not mistaken.

Is there some other similar interface that would have
a browser interface?

regards
Kaarle Kaila / Finland
